physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Seizure episodes, including right-sided clonic movements and generalized tonic-clonic seizures. Mild goiter with hypothyroidism noted at age 14 years 7 months.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially seizure-free until age 8, after which seizures became refractory and associated with right-sided spastic hemiparesis, dysphasia, and developmental delay.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Seizures presented as action myoclonic jerks, partial seizures, and right hemiparesis noted at 3 years 9 months. Extensive left frontal cortical atrophy and elevated serum ANA at a dilution of 1:640.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial treatment ineffective; after high-dose steroids, motor and cognitive functions deteriorated. Underwent left functional hemispherectomy leading to seizure cessation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presenting with partial complex seizures; brain MRI showed area of abnormal signal in the left frontal lobe. CSF analysis indicated red cell elevation and oligoclonal bands.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition stabilized temporarily after high-dose steroids, but progressed with relapsed seizures culminating in further treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Intractable partial epilepsy diagnosed at age 14, with significant clinical deterioration noted over time.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Conditions progressed with severe symptoms consistent with systemic lupus erythematosus, requiring treatment adjustments for the multiple autoimmune conditions.
